OPTION.NAME: --abs_directory
OPTION.HELP: Absolute listing directory (default is .obj dir)

OPTION.NAME: --absolute_listing
OPTION.HELP: Generate absolute listing file

OPTION.NAME: --aliased_variables
OPTION.TIP: Assume called funcs create hidden aliases (rare)
OPTION.HELP: Assume called funcs create hidden aliases (rare)

OPTION.NAME: --asm_define
OPTION.HELP: Pre-define the assembly symbol NAME, optionally setting its contents to 'value'.

OPTION.NAME: --asm_dependency
OPTION.HELP: Generate assembly dependency information

OPTION.NAME: --asm_directory
OPTION.HELP: Assembly file directory (default is .)

OPTION.NAME: --asm_extension
OPTION.HELP: Extension for assembly files (default is .asm)

OPTION.NAME: --asm_file
OPTION.TIP: File is an assembly file (default for .asm)
OPTION.HELP: File is an assembly file (default for .asm)

OPTION.NAME: --asm_includes
OPTION.TIP: Generate first-level assembly include file list
OPTION.HELP: Generate first-level assembly include file list

OPTION.NAME: --asm_listing
OPTION.HELP: Generate listing file

OPTION.NAME: --asm_undefine
OPTION.HELP: Undefine assembly symbol NAME

OPTION.NAME: --auto_inline
OPTION.HELP: Specify threshold for automatic inlining

OPTION.NAME: --c_extension
OPTION.HELP: Extension for C files (default is .c)

OPTION.NAME: --c_file
OPTION.TIP: File is a C file (default for .c/no ext)
OPTION.HELP: File is a C file (default for .c/no ext)

OPTION.NAME: --c_src_interlist
OPTION.TIP: Generate C source interlisted assembly file
OPTION.HELP: Generate C source interlisted assembly file

OPTION.NAME: --call_assumptions
OPTION.HELP:
Specify assumptions to make about function calls when optimizing.
Level 0 (-op0) indicates that the module has functions that are called from other modules.
Level 1 (-op1) indicates that the module does not have functions that are called by other modules but has global variables that are modified in other modules.
Level 2 (-op2) indicates that the module does not have functions that are called or globals that are modified by other modules.
Level 3 (-op3) indicates that the module has functions that are called by other modules but does not have globals that are modified by other modules.

OPTION.NAME: --check_misra
OPTION.HELP: Enable validation of MISRA-C:2004 rules.

OPTION.NAME: --cmd_file
OPTION.HELP: Read additional compile options the specified filename.

OPTION.NAME: --code_model
OPTION.HELP: Specify the code memory model to be used. Small code model only allows code to be located in the low 64k of memory while large code model allows code to be located anywhere in memory. Large-code model has a slight performance penalty. This option only applies to MSP430X devices.

OPTION.NAME: --compile_only
OPTION.HELP: Disable linking, overriding -z (if used).

OPTION.NAME: --compiler_revision
OPTION.HELP: Print out the compiler release revision and exit.

OPTION.NAME: --copy_file
OPTION.HELP: Simulate source '.copy filename'

OPTION.NAME: --cpp_default
OPTION.TIP: Treat C files as C++ files
OPTION.HELP: Treat C files as C++ files

OPTION.NAME: --cpp_extension
OPTION.HELP: Extension for C++ files (default is .cpp)

OPTION.NAME: --cpp_file
OPTION.TIP: File is a C++ file (default for .C .cpp .cc)
OPTION.HELP: File is a C++ file (default for .C .cpp .cc)

OPTION.NAME: --cross_reference
OPTION.HELP: Generate cross reference file

OPTION.NAME: --data_model
OPTION.HELP: Specify the data memory model to be used. Small data model only allows data to be located in the low 64k of memory. Large data model allows data to be located anywhere in memory, but there is an associated performance penalty. The restricted model allows data to be located anywhere in memory, but individual objects cannot be greater than 64k in size. Restricted data model has less performance overhead than the large data model and is the default. This option only applies to MSP430X devices.

OPTION.NAME: --define
OPTION.HELP: Pre-define a symbol with the id 'NAME', optionally setting it's contents to 'value'.

OPTION.NAME: --diag_error
OPTION.HELP: Treat diagnostic <id> as error

OPTION.NAME: --diag_remark
OPTION.HELP: Treat diagnostic <id> as remark

OPTION.NAME: --diag_suppress
OPTION.HELP: Suppress diagnostic <id>

OPTION.NAME: --diag_warning
OPTION.HELP: Treat diagnostic <id> as warning

OPTION.NAME: --display_error_number
OPTION.HELP: Emit the diagnostic identifier numbers along with diagnostic messages. These identifiers can be used with options such as -pds to suppress a specific diagnostic.

OPTION.NAME: --embedded_cpp
OPTION.HELP: Enable support for embedded C++

OPTION.NAME: --entry_hook
OPTION.TIP: Insert this call at entry to each function
OPTION.HELP: Insert this call at entry to each function

OPTION.NAME: --entry_parm
OPTION.TIP: Pass caller's name or address to entry hook
OPTION.HELP: Pass caller's name or address to entry hook

OPTION.NAME: --exceptions
OPTION.HELP: Enable C++ exception handling

OPTION.NAME: --exit_hook
OPTION.TIP: Insert this call at exit from each function
OPTION.HELP: Insert this call at exit from each function

OPTION.NAME: --exit_parm
OPTION.TIP: Pass caller's name or address to exit hook
OPTION.HELP: Pass caller's name or address to exit hook

OPTION.NAME: --fp_reassoc
OPTION.HELP: Set to on to allow reassociation of floating point arithmetic even in cases where the reassociation will result in a slightly different answer.

OPTION.NAME: --gcc
OPTION.HELP: This option enables the support for GCC extensions. This feature is incompatible with strict ANSI mode.

OPTION.NAME: --gen_acp_raw
OPTION.HELP: Output raw listing to .rl file

OPTION.NAME: --gen_acp_xref
OPTION.HELP: Output xref listing to .crl file

OPTION.NAME: --gen_opt_info
OPTION.TIP: Generate optimizer information file at level [0-2]
OPTION.HELP: Set the optimizer information file level, or disable with 0. Level 1 includes basic information. Level 2 includes detailed information. The file will be created in the assembly directory if a custom asm directory is specified on the command line otherwise it will be created in the object file directory.

OPTION.NAME: --global_register
OPTION.TIP: Reserve a register for use by the user.
OPTION.HELP: Reserve the specified register for use by the user. It will not be used by the compiler. If only reserving one global register it is preferable for performance reasons to reserve r4.

OPTION.NAME: --help
OPTION.HELP: Show usage information. When followed by another option or a phrase display that option's detailed information, or search for options related to that phrase.

OPTION.NAME: --include_file
OPTION.HELP: Simulate source '.include filename'

OPTION.NAME: --include_path
OPTION.HELP: Add the specified dir(ectory) to the #include file search path list.

OPTION.NAME: --issue_remarks
OPTION.HELP: Issue remarks, which are normally suppressed.

OPTION.NAME: --keep_asm
OPTION.TIP: Keep the generated assembly language (.asm) file
OPTION.HELP: Keep the generated assembly language (.asm) file

OPTION.NAME: --keep_unneeded_statics
OPTION.TIP: Do not delete unreferenced static variables
OPTION.HELP: The parser, by default, will remark about and then remove any unreferenced static variables. This option will keep the parser from deleting unreferenced static variables and any static functions that are, in turn referenced by these variables.

OPTION.NAME: --kr_compatible
OPTION.HELP: Enable K & R C compatibility.

OPTION.NAME: --large_memory_model
OPTION.HELP: Build using a large-data model. This allows data to be placed in memory locations above the 64k boundary and individual objects can be larger than 64k in size. Only valid for MSP430X devices.

OPTION.NAME: --list_directory
OPTION.HELP: Listing/xref file directory (default is .obj dir)

OPTION.NAME: --listing_extension
OPTION.HELP: Extension for listing files (default is .lst)

OPTION.NAME: --misra_advisory
OPTION.TIP: Set error category for MISRA advisory rules
OPTION.HELP: Set error category for MISRA advisory rules.

OPTION.NAME: --misra_required
OPTION.TIP: Set error category for MISRA required rules
OPTION.HELP: Set error category for MISRA required rules.

OPTION.NAME: --multibyte_chars
OPTION.HELP: Enable multibyte character support in the parser.

OPTION.NAME: --near_data
OPTION.TIP: Indicates what data must be near
OPTION.HELP: Indicates whether certain types of data are guaranteed to be in the near 64k of memory and allows the compiler to optimize performance based on this information. Globals indicates that all global and static variables will be located in near memory. This option only applies to MSP430X devices.

OPTION.NAME: --no_const_clink
OPTION.HELP: Do not generate .clink directives for const global arrays. By default these arrays are placed in a .const subsection and conditionally linked.

OPTION.NAME: --no_inlining
OPTION.HELP: Ignore the inline keyword while parsing.

OPTION.NAME: --no_intrinsics
OPTION.HELP: Disable intrinsic functions in the parser.

OPTION.NAME: --no_warnings
OPTION.HELP: Suppress all parser warnings.

OPTION.NAME: --obj_directory
OPTION.HELP: Object file directory (default is .)

OPTION.NAME: --obj_extension
OPTION.HELP: Extension for object files (default is .obj)

OPTION.NAME: --obj_file
OPTION.TIP: File is an object file (default for .obj)
OPTION.HELP: File is an object file (default for .obj)

OPTION.NAME: --opt_for_speed
OPTION.HELP: Control speed vs. size trade-offs in optimization. A value of 5 indicates fully optimizing for speed with a potentially large code size penalty while a value of 0 indicates fully optimizing for size. Values between 0 and 5 indicate trade-offs between the two extremes. If this option is not specified a default value of 1 is used. If the option is specified with no argument then a value of 4 is used.

OPTION.NAME: --opt_level
OPTION.HELP:
Set compiler optimization level.
Level 0 includes register optimizations. Level 1 adds local optimizations. Level 2 further adds global optimizations. Level 3 further adds interprocedure optimizations. Level 4 adds whole program optimizations. Level 4 must be passed to the linker for the optimizations to take affect.
Using -O without arguments defaults to -O2.

OPTION.NAME: --optimize_with_debug
OPTION.TIP: Optimize fully in the presence of debug directives
OPTION.HELP: Optimize fully in the presence of debug directives

OPTION.NAME: --optimizer_interlist
OPTION.HELP: Generate optimized source interlisted assembly

OPTION.NAME: --output_all_syms
OPTION.TIP: Keep local symbols in output file
OPTION.HELP: Keep local symbols in output file

OPTION.NAME: --plain_char
OPTION.TIP: Specify how to treat plain chars (signed/unsigned)
OPTION.HELP: Specify how to treat plain chars (signed/unsigned)

OPTION.NAME: --pp_directory
OPTION.HELP: Place preprocessor output files in specified directory. The directory must exist prior to compiler invocation.

OPTION.NAME: --preinclude
OPTION.HELP: Include the source code of the indicated file at the beginning of the compilation. This can be used to establish standard macro definitions, etc. The file name is searched for in the directories on the include search list. The files are processed in the order in which they were specified.

OPTION.NAME: --preproc_dependency
OPTION.HELP: Generate a dependency list for the source file into the file <filename>.pp and then exit. Optionally, name the output file. The output will include all files included in the source file as well as any of the files included. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the dependency list (similar to gcc).

OPTION.NAME: --preproc_includes
OPTION.HELP: Generate an include list for the source file into the file <filename>.pp and then exit. Optionally, name the output file. The output will include only those files directly included by the source file. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the include list (similar to gcc).

OPTION.NAME: --preproc_macros
OPTION.TIP: Generate list of pre- & user-defined macros
OPTION.HELP: Generate a list of predefined and user defined macros for the source file into the file <filename>.pp and then exit. Optionally, name the output file. The output will include only those files directly included by the source file. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the macro list (similar to gcc).

OPTION.NAME: --preproc_only
OPTION.HELP: Only preprocess the source file(s) and then stop.

OPTION.NAME: --preproc_with_comment
OPTION.HELP: Only preprocess the source file(s) and then stop; maintain source comments in the output.

OPTION.NAME: --preproc_with_compile
OPTION.HELP: This option instructs the compiler to additionally continue compilation of the source file (rather than exiting) after generating a pre-processing .pp output file such as those generated by -ppd (dependencies) -ppi (included files), or -ppm (macros).

OPTION.NAME: --preproc_with_line
OPTION.HELP: Only preprocess the source file(s) and then stop; maintain #line directives in the output..

OPTION.NAME: --printf_support
OPTION.HELP:
Printf/sprintf functions use a common low level routine, _printfi which processes a given printf format string. The full version of _printfi provides formatting capabilities that are not required in typical embedded applications. To address this the C runtime library also includes two limited of versions of _printfi that provide a useful subset of the formatting features specified by C library standard.
One version excludes support for printing floating values. All format specifiers except for %f, %g, %G, %e, or %E are supported. To specify this version use the option '--printf_support=nofloat' when linking.
The other version only supports printing of integer, char, or string values without width or precision flags. Only %%, %d, %o, %c, %s and %x are supported. To specify this version use the option '--printf_support=minimal' when linking.

OPTION.NAME: --program_level_compile
OPTION.HELP: Enable program mode compilation.

OPTION.NAME: --quiet
OPTION.HELP: Suppress common compiler non-diagnostic output. Remarks, errors and warnings will still be generated, as well as feature specific status.

OPTION.NAME: --relaxed_ansi
OPTION.HELP: Enable relaxed ANSI source parsing mode.

OPTION.NAME: --remove_hooks_when_inlining
OPTION.TIP: Remove entry/exit hooks from inlined functions
OPTION.HELP: Remove the entry and exit hooks from the bodies of inlined functions.

OPTION.NAME: --rtti
OPTION.HELP: Support C++ run-time type information

OPTION.NAME: --run_linker
OPTION.HELP: After compiling all the source files, perform a link and pass all the options following this option to the linker.

OPTION.NAME: --sat_reassoc
OPTION.HELP: Set to on to allow reassociation of saturating arithmetic even in cases where the reassociation will cause saturation to occur differently.

OPTION.NAME: --set_error_limit
OPTION.HELP: Set error limit to <count>

OPTION.NAME: --silicon_errata
OPTION.HELP: The compiler will use workarounds and emit warnings as necessary to properly handle the specified silicon errata.

OPTION.NAME: --silicon_version
OPTION.HELP: Specify silicon core version.

OPTION.NAME: --single_inline
OPTION.HELP: Inline function that are called only once. Will inline these functions even if auto inlining has been turned off (-oi0)

OPTION.NAME: --skip_assembler
OPTION.HELP: Compile only; do not assemble

OPTION.NAME: --small_enum
OPTION.TIP: Enums may be char/short, instead of int
OPTION.HELP: Enums may be char/short, instead of int

OPTION.NAME: --src_interlist
OPTION.HELP: Generate interlisted assembly file

OPTION.NAME: --static_template_instantiation
OPTION.HELP: All template entities are instantiated as needed in the file. The instantiations are given internal (static) linkage.

OPTION.NAME: --std_lib_func_defined
OPTION.TIP: File contains an RTS library function.
OPTION.HELP: File contains an RTS library function.

OPTION.NAME: --std_lib_func_not_defined
OPTION.TIP: File does not define any RTS library func (def.)
OPTION.HELP: File does not define any RTS library func (def.)

OPTION.NAME: --std_lib_func_redefined
OPTION.TIP: File redefines an RTS library function.
OPTION.HELP: File redefines an RTS library function.

OPTION.NAME: --strict_ansi
OPTION.HELP: Enable strict ANSI source parsing mode. Any source violating strict ANSI guidelines will generate a parsing error.

OPTION.NAME: --super_quiet
OPTION.HELP: Suppress all compiler non-diagnostic output. Remarks, errors and warnings will still be generated.

OPTION.NAME: --symdebug:dwarf
OPTION.HELP: Enable full symbolic DWARF debugging in the generated object or out file.

OPTION.NAME: --symdebug:none
OPTION.HELP: Disable debug and suppress all symbolic debug information from being included in the generated object or out file.

OPTION.NAME: --symdebug:skeletal
OPTION.HELP: Enable symbolic debug information for program analysis. (default)

OPTION.NAME: --syms_ignore_case
OPTION.HELP: Symbol names are not case-significant

OPTION.NAME: --temp_directory
OPTION.HELP: Temporary file directory (default is .)

OPTION.NAME: --tool_version
OPTION.TIP: Print version numbers for each tool
OPTION.HELP: Print version numbers for each tool

OPTION.NAME: --undefine
OPTION.HELP: Undefine the symbol with the id 'NAME'.

OPTION.NAME: --verbose
OPTION.TIP: Display banner and function progress information
OPTION.HELP: Display progress information and toolset version when executing.

OPTION.NAME: --verbose_diagnostics
OPTION.HELP: Enable verbose diagnostic information from the parser, including the source line of the error and an indicator of the error position within the line.

OPTION.NAME: --write_diagnostics_file
OPTION.HELP: Write diagnostics to an .err file instead of the standard output. The file name with be the same as the source file but with an .err extension.

OPTION.NAME: --absolute_exe
OPTION.HELP: Produce absolute executable object file (default)

OPTION.NAME: --arg_size
OPTION.HELP: Set C argc/argv memory size

OPTION.NAME: --define
OPTION.HELP: Pre-define preprocessor macro _name_ to _value_

OPTION.NAME: --diag_error
OPTION.HELP: Treat diagnostic <id> as error

OPTION.NAME: --diag_remark
OPTION.HELP: Treat diagnostic <id> as remark

OPTION.NAME: --diag_suppress
OPTION.HELP: Suppress diagnostic <id>

OPTION.NAME: --diag_warning
OPTION.HELP: Treat diagnostic <id> as warning

OPTION.NAME: --disable_auto_rts
OPTION.HELP: Disable automatic RTS selection

OPTION.NAME: --disable_clink
OPTION.HELP: Disable conditional linking; ignore all .clink directives.

OPTION.NAME: --disable_pp
OPTION.TIP: Don't use C preprocessor for command files
OPTION.HELP: This disables preprocessing of linker command files.

OPTION.NAME: --display_error_number
OPTION.HELP: Emit diagnostic identifier numbers

OPTION.NAME: --entry_point
OPTION.TIP: Specify program entry point for the output module
OPTION.HELP: Specify program entry point for the output module

OPTION.NAME: --fill_value
OPTION.TIP: Default fill value for holes in output sections
OPTION.HELP: Set the default fill value for filling holes in output sections.

OPTION.NAME: --generate_dead_funcs_list
OPTION.TIP: List removed dead functions into file
OPTION.HELP: Create a list, into the file <fname>, of the routines and sections that are dead (never referenced) and were removed by the linker. The default <fname> is 'dead_funcs.txt'.

OPTION.NAME: --globalize
OPTION.TIP: Do not localize symbols matching pattern
OPTION.HELP: The option '--localize=l_pattern' makes the symbols matching the l_pattern hidden. The '--globalilze=g_pattern' option excludes symbols matching g_pattern from symbol localization provided g_pattern is more restrictive than l_pattern.

OPTION.NAME: --heap_size
OPTION.TIP: Heap size for C/C++ dynamic memory allocation
OPTION.HELP: Specify the maximum heap size for C/C++ dynamic memory allocation.

OPTION.NAME: --hide
OPTION.HELP: Hide the symbols matching the pattern by changing the name to empty string

OPTION.NAME: --issue_remarks
OPTION.HELP: Issue remarks

OPTION.NAME: --library
OPTION.TIP: Include library file or command file as input
OPTION.HELP: Include library file or command file as input

OPTION.NAME: --linker_help
OPTION.HELP: Display usage information. Followed by another option, will display detailed information on that option.

OPTION.NAME: --localize
OPTION.TIP: Make the symbols matching pattern local
OPTION.HELP: Given a symbol name pattern, make all the symbols matching this pattern local

OPTION.NAME: --make_global
OPTION.TIP: Don't make global symbol static if -h is specified
OPTION.HELP: Don't make global symbol static if -h is specified

OPTION.NAME: --make_static
OPTION.HELP: Make all global symbols static

OPTION.NAME: --map_file
OPTION.TIP: Input and output sections listed into <file>
OPTION.HELP: Produce a listing of all input and output sections into <file>.

OPTION.NAME: --mapfile_contents
OPTION.TIP: Display attribute settings in map file
OPTION.HELP: Enable the display of <attribute> or disable with no<attribute> in the linker generated map file. Multiple attributes can be specified by separating them with commas (e.g. --mapfile_contents=sections,nosymbols). Type --mapfile_contents=help for a list of attributes.

OPTION.NAME: --no_demangle
OPTION.TIP: Don't demangle symbol names in diagnostics
OPTION.HELP: Don't demangle symbol names in diagnostics

OPTION.NAME: --no_sym_merge
OPTION.TIP: No type merging in symbolic debugging information
OPTION.HELP: Disable type merging in symbolic debugging information.

OPTION.NAME: --no_symtable
OPTION.TIP: Strip symbol table and line number entries
OPTION.HELP: Strip symbol table and line number entries

OPTION.NAME: --no_warnings
OPTION.HELP: Suppress warnings

OPTION.NAME: --output_file
OPTION.HELP: Full filename of the output file.

OPTION.NAME: --preferred_order
OPTION.TIP: Add <function> to preferred placement order list
OPTION.HELP: Insert a function into the preferred function order list for placement. Functions that are close to each other in the preferred function order list will tend to be placed close together (increase program locality between them). Static functions of the same name can be distinguished from each other by prefixing the function name with the path and file in which the function is defined followed by a ':' character to delimit the beginning of the function name.

OPTION.NAME: --priority
OPTION.HELP: Search libraries in priority order

OPTION.NAME: --ram_model
OPTION.HELP: Link using RAM autoinitialization model

OPTION.NAME: --relocatable
OPTION.HELP: Produce a relocatable output module

OPTION.NAME: --reread_libs
OPTION.HELP: Reread libraries; resolve backward references

OPTION.NAME: --rom_model
OPTION.HELP: Link using ROM autoinitialization model

OPTION.NAME: --run_abs
OPTION.HELP: Produce absolute listing file

OPTION.NAME: --scan_libraries
OPTION.TIP: Scan libraries for duplicate symbol definitions
OPTION.HELP: Check whether symbol definitions that are pulled into the link are duplicated in any of the libraries included in the build. This information is typically ignored as the linker will pull in the first definition it encounters.

OPTION.NAME: --search_path
OPTION.HELP: Alter the library-search algorithm to look in dir before looking in the default location. This option must appear before the -l option.

OPTION.NAME: --set_error_limit
OPTION.HELP: Set error limit to <count>

OPTION.NAME: --stack_size
OPTION.HELP: Set C system stack size

OPTION.NAME: --strict_compatibility
OPTION.HELP: Strict compatibility checking

OPTION.NAME: --symbol_map
OPTION.TIP: Specify a symbol map, mapping refname to defname
OPTION.HELP: Symbol mapping allows a symbol reference to be resolved by a symbol with different name. Symbol mapping allows functions to be overridden with alternate definitions. This feature can be used to patch in alternate implementations, which provide patches (bug fixes) or alternate functionality. For example, the option --symbol_map='foo=foo_patch' makes the linker resolve any references to foo by the definition foo_patch.

OPTION.NAME: --undef_sym
OPTION.TIP: Add <sym> to symbol table as an unresolved symbol
OPTION.HELP: Add <sym> to symbol table as an unresolved symbol

OPTION.NAME: --undefine
OPTION.HELP: Undefine preprocessor macro _name_

OPTION.NAME: --unhide
OPTION.TIP: Exclude symbols matching pattern from hiding
OPTION.HELP: The option --hide=hide_pattern makes the symbols matching the hide_pattern hidden. The --unhide=unhide_pattern option excludes symbols matching unhide_pattern from symbol hiding provided unhide_pattern is more restrictive than hide_pattern.

OPTION.NAME: --use_hw_mpy
OPTION.TIP: Link in hardware version of RTS mpy routine
OPTION.HELP: Replaces all references to the default integer/long multiply routines with the version of the multiply routine that uses the hardware multiplier. 16 uses the 16-bit hardware multiplier, 32 uses the F4xxx 32-bit hardware multiplier, and F5 uses the F5xxx 32-bit hardware multiplier.

OPTION.NAME: --verbose_diagnostics
OPTION.HELP: Verbose diagnostics

OPTION.NAME: --warn_sections
OPTION.TIP: Warn if an unspecified output section is created
OPTION.HELP: Warn if an unspecified output section is created

OPTION.NAME: --xml_link_info
OPTION.HELP: Produce a detailed link information data-base into the file named <file>.
